title: Lacrosse in Pennsylvania
data: Only undefeated Bucknell team , won the Patriot league title in 1996 , wins over Penn , Army and Navy . Controversially , did not make 1996 NCAA Tournament despite one of the best records in Division I
No . 7 ranked team in 2011 , won the Patriot league title . Led Virginia in 1st round of 2011 NCAA Tournament 10-6 , losing game to eventual National Champion 13-12 in overtime
Won the 2019 NCAA Division III tournament . 1st PA men 's team to win Division III lacrosse title
1st Drexel squad to make NCAA Tournament . Defeated # 4 seed Penn 16-11 in 1st Round . Reached NCAA quarterfinals
2009 Division III National Finalist . Lost finals to Cortland State 9-7 . Bullets made Division III finals three times during the 2000s
Won school 's 1st Patriot league title in lacrosse . No . 7 seed in 2012 NCAAs . Ranked 4th in nation . Lost to National Title runner-up Maryland in 1st round 10-9 with 7 seconds remaining in game
Won the 2011 NCAA Division II tournament . 1st PA men 's team to win Division II lacrosse title . Also 1st PA men 's team to win a national lacrosse title of any kind since 1959

1st PA based Division I team to reach NCAA Final Four . Led by coach Tony Seaman , Chris Flynn was named NCAA 1st team . In 1988 NCAA tournament , lost to Gary Gait led Syracuse team 11-10 in national semifinals , with Gait making the famous Air Gait jump shot from behind Penn 's goal
2008 Women 's NCAA Division I tournament finalist , losing to Northwestern 10-6 . Won Ivy league title , defeated number one Northwestern during the regular season
Won 3 national collegiate ( USWLA ) championships in 1978 , 1979 and 1980 , defeating Maryland , Massachusetts and Maryland , with a 3-year total record of 45-1-3 under head coach Gillian Rattray
Won the 1987 Women 's NCAA Division I tournament with a record of 17-2 , defeated Temple in title game 7-6 , led by leading scorer Amanda Veal
Won the 1989 Women 's NCAA Division I tournament with a record of 19-1 , defeated Harvard in title game 7-6 , led by 1990 NCAA Player of the Year Diane Whipple
Seeded No . 8 in the 2013 NCAA Lacrosse tournament , PSU 's 1st ever NCAA seeding . Austin Kaut that season became only 3rd PA prep player to win NCAA Goalie of the Year award
Seeded No . 1 in the 2019 NCAA tournament , 1st ever Pennsylvania team to get number one NCAA seeding , 2nd PA team to make the Final Four

One of the top teams during pre-NCAA season , 1953 . Led by National Lacrosse Hall of Famer Avery Blake Jr. , one of the top all-time assist men Orville Wright , and National Lacrosse Hall of Fame coach Avery Blake Sr. . Swarthmore 's lone loss that season was a 14-13 defeat to Johns Hopkins
Won the 1988 Women 's NCAA Division I tournament going undefeated , defeating Penn State 15-7 , led by National Lacrosse Hall of Famer Amanda O'Leary . O'Leary also won NCAA Player of the Year
intro: Lacrosse has been played in Pennsylvania since the 19th century. There are many respected amateur programs at the club, college, and high school level, as well as several respected past and present professional teams in the National Lacrosse League (NLL) and Major League Lacrosse (MLL).
